paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR Gly83Arg mutation, detailing its clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual patient records.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTR) with ocular and neurological symptoms

individual_records.phenotype_details: initially presented with blurred vision, later developed sensory-motor polyneuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: All six patients presented with ocular symptoms initially, mainly manifested as alternating and recurrent blurred vision in both eyes.

individual_records.phenotype_details: initially presented with blurred vision, later developed mild autonomic dysfunction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: All six patients presented with ocular symptoms initially, mainly manifested as alternating and recurrent blurred vision in both eyes.

individual_records.phenotype_details: initially presented with blurred vision, later developed mild autonomic dysfunction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: All six patients presented with ocular symptoms initially, mainly manifested as alternating and recurrent blurred vision in both eyes.

individual_records.phenotype_details: initially presented with blurred vision, later developed severe autonomic dysfunction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The remaining patients (II-4 and III-5,6) suffered from varying degrees of diarrhea, constipation, impotence, dysuria, and skin color changes.

individual_records.phenotype_details: initially presented with blurred vision, later developed severe autonomic dysfunction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The remaining patients (II-4 and III-5,6) suffered from varying degrees of diarrhea, constipation, impotence, dysuria, and skin color changes.

individual_records.phenotype_details: initially presented with blurred vision, later developed severe autonomic dysfunction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The remaining patients (II-4 and III-5,6) suffered from varying degrees of diarrhea, constipation, impotence, dysuria, and skin color changes.
None of the above was found in either of the two carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: slight enlargement of median nerves at proximal sites
individual_records.evidence_sentence: For the two asymptomatic carriers, carrier-II had a slight enlargement of median nerves at proximal sites with 13.1 and 11.6 mm2 on the left and right sides.

functional_data.summary: The Gly83Arg mutation leads to ocular and neurological symptoms, with varying degrees of autonomic dysfunction.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, as all affected individuals in the study carry the mutation.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the unique clinical features of the Gly83Arg mutation in the Chinese population.
key_quotes: This is a detailed account of Gly83Arg mutation-related ATTR, focusing on the extraocular presentations of this special variant in Chinese.
All six patients presented with ocular symptoms initially, mainly manifested as alternating and recurrent blurred vision in both eyes.

tables_processed.table_caption: Characteristics of patients with symptomatic Gly83Arg-related ATTR in this study and reviews.
Extraocular characteristics of patients with symptomatic ATTR having the Gly83Arg variant.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
